page.title: 20BROADBRIDGE HEATH RESIDENT
page.content:
A resident was interviewed about the Broadbridge Heath area.He has lived there for 8 years and has 3 children. The changes he notices most are the new developments especially the housing.Although so many houses have been built,the facilities in the village have not improved.Most needed are a chemist,a doctor and a dentist nearer than those in Horsham. The road through Broadbridge Heath is quieter now the by-pass is there but some people,in order to avoid traffic,make a detour,driving too fast through the village. On the whole,the atmosphere is not like a true English village, or a town but is mid-way between the two.
The survey was carried out by the {Third Form girls of Farlington School, an independent school at Strood Park.
